It's understandable to feel this way, but remember that being healthy doesn't necessarily mean depriving yourself completely of the foods you love. Here are a few strategies to help you stay motivated while still enjoying your favorite foods:

1. Incorporate your favorite foods in moderation: You can still enjoy your favorite foods by incorporating them into your diet in moderation. Practice portion control and balance these indulgences with healthy, nutrient-rich foods.

2. Find healthier alternatives: Look for healthier alternatives to your favorite foods, like healthier versions of pizza, sweets, or sandwiches. You can also experiment with new recipes that use healthier ingredients but still taste delicious.

3. Celebrate other aspects of a healthy lifestyle: It's not just about the food! Celebrate how much better you feel when you eat well and move more. Take note of your increased energy, reduced stress, improved mood, or better sleep.

4. Don’t be too hard on yourself: Remember that it’s OK to indulge once in a while. As long as you make healthy choices most of the time, enjoying an occasional treat won’t derail your progress.

5. Think long-term: Keep in mind that the habits you build now will have a lasting impact on your health and wellbeing. Making healthy changes is an investment in your future self.

Remember, sustainable healthy habits take time to build, but the rewards are worth it in the end. Keep your focus on progress, not perfection, and enjoy your health journey.
